update.title: AABB to Dome

content.raw: pass `false` as second arg to avoid the visual cloning the white material, i.e. `wireBoxVis->SetMaterial(white, false);`
content.html: pass false as second arg to avoid the visual cloning the white material, i.e. wireBoxVis->SetMaterial(white, false);

this creates a new material each time the function is called.

Instead, you can create a material with a unique name once, and reuse it the next time, e.g. 

auto white = this->scene->Material("highlight_material")
if (!mat)
{
  white = scene->CreateMaterial("highlight_material");
  ...
}

‌

content.raw: Sounds good, just updated the emissive property of the  bounding box material and it shows as white in ogre2
content.html: Sounds good, just updated the emissive property of the bounding box material and it shows as white in ogre2

update.description: See PR that this PR is dependent upon: [ign-rendering#250](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/250) - merged
update.title: AABB to Dome

content.raw: yeah the darker gray color is due to lighting. The default ogre2 PBR material does not have option to ignore lighting. The easiest thing to do as a workaround is to set emissive properties to white as well.
content.html: yeah the darker gray color is due to lighting. The default ogre2 PBR material does not have option to ignore lighting. The easiest thing to do as a workaround is to set emissive properties to white as well.

content.raw: @{iche033} anythoughts? Do we need to add some emissive properties, or tell the material to ignore lighting conditions?
content.html: @Ian Chen anythoughts? Do we need to add some emissive properties, or tell the material to ignore lighting conditions?

content.raw: I updated the material to be white \(r = g = b = 1\) and it’s white in ogre1 but displays as a default gray-ish color in ogre2, not sure why ogre2 shows gray, but I assume this might also be why the ground plane is white in ogre1 and gray in ogre2.
content.html: I updated the material to be white (r = g = b = 1) and it’s white in ogre1 but displays as a default gray-ish color in ogre2, not sure why ogre2 shows gray, but I assume this might also be why the ground plane is white in ogre1 and gray in ogre2.

content.raw:
I'm giving a +1 to the bright white. We can change the ground plane to be non-white, if needed.
The bright white is more obvious.
content.html: I'm giving a +1 to the bright white. We can change the ground plane to be non-white, if needed. The bright white is more obvious.

content.html: Thanks. I created issue #56 for this. We might need to create a special doxygen page to list these keywords.

content.raw: I don’t think we have it documented anywhere else, but we definitely should as a couple key words like are beginning to be used for specific purposes \(`gazebo-entity`, `pause-update`\).  Where do you think this information should be held?  I can add the docs
content.html: I don’t think we have it documented anywhere else, but we definitely should as a couple key words like are beginning to be used for specific purposes (gazebo-entity, pause-update). Where do you think this information should be held? I can add the docs

content.raw: Is the "gazebo-entity" name documented someplace. I see it used multiple places, but I don't know when I (as a developer) should use it. I'm just looking for information, not a change to this PR.
content.html: Is the "gazebo-entity" name documented someplace. I see it used multiple places, but I don't know when I (as a developer) should use it. I'm just looking for information, not a change to this PR.

content.raw: Changelog please.
content.html: Changelog please.

content.raw: Maybe we should have a third color for the wire boxes?  The reason I didn’t like white too much is that the ogre1 ground is white and the same issue with visibility occurs, would dark gray be good?
content.html: Maybe we should have a third color for the wire boxes? The reason I didn’t like white too much is that the ogre1 ground is white and the same issue with visibility occurs, would dark gray be good?

content.raw: Works great! I just have some comments on the `ign-rendering` PR and this one.
content.html: Works great! I just have some comments on the ign-rendering PR and this one.

content.raw: How about putting the new code inside `High/LowlightNode` and removing all the stuff that's there to change materials?
content.html: How about putting the new code inside High/LowlightNode and removing all the stuff that's there to change materials?

content.raw: At @{557058:798a6cdf-d171-444d-b8af-5d088f9feb2d} 's suggestion, we should be using `unordered_map`s whenever the order is not important, like in this case.
content.html: At @Luca Della Vedova 's suggestion, we should be using unordered_maps whenever the order is not important, like in this case.
